articles.headline: United Said to Restart Talks With US Airways
articles.snippet: Although rival carrier Continental Airlines abandoned merger talks, United will keep looking for a partner, its chief executive, Glenn F. Tilton, said.
articles.abstract: Although rival carrier Continental Airlines abandoned merger talks, United will keep looking for a partner, its chief executive, Glenn F. Tilton, said.
articles.lead_paragraph: For the last five years, Glenn F. Tilton has talked often about the need for mergers and consolidation in the airline industry, hanging out the equivalent of a “for sale” sign at his troubled United Airlines.

articles.headline: Oil Price Rise Fails to Open Tap
articles.snippet: A central reason that oil supplies are not rising with demand is that major producers outside OPEC, like Russia, Mexico and Norway, are showing signs of sluggishness.
articles.abstract: A central reason that oil supplies are not rising with demand is that major producers outside OPEC, like Russia, Mexico and Norway, are showing signs of sluggishness.
articles.lead_paragraph: As oil prices soared to record levels in recent years, basic economics suggested that consumption would fall and supplies would rise as producers drilled for more oil.

articles.headline: Kerkorian Buys Stake in Ford
articles.snippet: Upon completing his offer for a total of 120 million shares, Kirk Kerkorian would own a 5.6 percent stake in Detroit’s second-largest automaker.
articles.abstract: Upon completing his offer for a total of 120 million shares, Kirk Kerkorian would own a 5.6 percent stake in Detroit’s second-largest automaker.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  This time, Kirk Kerkorian seems content to hitch a ride on the potential turnaround of a Detroit automaker instead of grabbing the wheel himself.

articles.headline: Exploiting Real Fears With ‘Virtual Kidnappings’
articles.snippet: The latest crime craze in Mexico relies on a variety of tricks to make people believe their loved ones are being held for ransom, when, in fact, they are not.
articles.abstract: The latest crime craze in Mexico relies on a variety of tricks to make people believe their loved ones are being held for ransom, when, in fact, they are not.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY  The phone call begins with the cries of an anguished child calling for a parent: “Mama! Papa!” The youngster’s sobs are quickly replaced by a husky male voice that means business.

articles.headline: Junk Bonds, Mortgages and Milken
articles.snippet: Michael R. Milken invented the junk bond and popularized securitization, but don’t blame him for the current mess.
articles.abstract: Michael R. Milken invented the junk bond and popularized securitization, but don’t blame him for the current mess.

articles.headline: For Gamers, the Craving Won’t Quit
articles.snippet: During the next two weeks, some five million couch jockeys are expected to plunk down $60 to buy Grand Theft Auto IV, the new release of a violent and episodic game.
articles.abstract: During the next two weeks, some five million couch jockeys are expected to plunk down $60 to buy Grand Theft Auto IV, the new release of a violent and episodic game.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  The troubled economy and rising prices for food and gas won’t keep fast-twitch video gamers from splurging on their latest must-have diversion, Grand Theft Auto IV.

articles.headline: Democrats Divided Over Gas Tax Break
articles.snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton endorsed a plan to suspend the federal excise tax on gasoline, while Barack Obama spoke out firmly against the proposal.
articles.abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton endorsed a plan to suspend the federal excise tax on gasoline, while Barack Obama spoke out firmly against the proposal.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  As angry truckers encircled the Capitol in a horn-blaring caravan and consumers across the country agonized over $60 fill-ups, the issue of high fuel prices flared on the campaign trail on Monday, sharply dividing the two Democratic candidates.

articles.headline: Not Speaking for Obama, Pastor Speaks for Himself, at Length
articles.snippet: It turns out that the Rev. Jeremiah A. Wright Jr. doesn’t hate America, but he loves the sound of his own voice.
articles.abstract: It turns out that the Rev. Jeremiah A. Wright Jr. doesn’t hate America, but he loves the sound of his own voice.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Rev. Jeremiah A. Wright Jr. has wriggled out from under sound bites and screen-grab loops to put himself into context in that most American of ways: on television.

articles.headline: Mars Offers $23 Billion Cash for Wrigley
articles.snippet: Analysts expect the companies to become a potent new marketing force as they try to appeal to a fast-growing markets in countries like China, India and Russia.
articles.abstract: Analysts expect the companies to become a potent new marketing force as they try to appeal to a fast-growing markets in countries like China, India and Russia.
articles.lead_paragraph: Against all odds, the chewing-gum aisle at the grocery store became a hotbed of creativity in recent years, as companies battled to find new ways to sell an immutable product, often by trying new combinations of coatings, fillings and packaging.
